There is another category of methods that utilize implicit intermediate supervision signals to train
Retrievers. For instance, NSM [54] employs a bidirectional search strategy, where two retrievers start searching from the head entity and tail entity, respectively. The supervised objective is to ensure that the paths searched by the two retrievers converge as closely as possible. KnowGPT [198] and
MINERVA [23] treat the selection of adjacent nodes to build paths or subgraphs as a Markov process.
